songs.title: Avisa meu mano
songs.translation:
Avisa meu mano
Warn my brother
avisa meu mano
Warn my brother
avisa meu mano
Warn my brother
Capoeira mandou me chamar
Capoeira has called me
Capoeira é luta nossa
Capoeira is our fight
Da era colonial
From colonial time
é nasceu foi na Bahia
It was born in Bahia
Angola e Regional
Angola and Regional

songs.title: San antonio quiero agua
songs.translation:
Santo António eu quero água
Santo António I want water
Santo António eu quero água
Santo António I want water
Quero água pra beber
I want water to drink
Quero água pra lavar
I want water to wash
Quero água pra benzer
I want water for blessings
Quero água
I want water
Quero água pra beber
I want water to drink
Quero água pra lavar
I want water to wash
Quero água pra benzer
I want water for blessings
Quero água
I want water
songs.history:
"Santo António" or Saint Anthony of Padua was a Franciscan priest born in the 12th century in Lisbon and died near Padua, Italy, on June 13, 1231. His cult spread mainly in the 15th and 16th centuries. He became the national saint of Portugal, whose explorers made him known to the whole world. He is the patron saint of sailors, castaways and prisoners, and from the 17th century, he is also invoked to find lost objects, then to recover health and, finally, to grant a wish.

In Brazil, as in all countries with a Portuguese tradition, he is also considered the “Holy Matchmaker”. In Portugal, for example, June 12 is the day of weddings and parties, and in Brazil, it is the day of lovers (the local Valentine's Day).

songs.title: Foi no clarao da lua
songs.translation:
Foi
It was
Foi no clarão da lua
It was in the moonlight
que eu vi acontecer
That I saw happen
num vale-tudo com o jiu-jitsu
in an anything goes with jiu-jitsu
o Capoeira vencer, mas foi
Capoeira win, but it was
Deu armada, deu rasteira
He gave armanda and a rasteira
meia lua e a ponteira
Meia-lua and ponteira
Logo no primeiro round
Right in the first round
venceu o Capoeira
Capoeira won
Em baixo do ringue
Under the ring
o mestre Bimba vibrava
Mestre Bimba vibrated
tocando seu berimbau
Playing his berimbau
enquanto a Muzenza cantava, 
While Muzenza sang
mas foi
But it was

songs.title: Sai Sai Catarina
songs.translation:
Sai sai catarina 
Come out, come out Catarina
saia do mar Venha ver Idalina
Get out of the sea, Idalina comes to see
Sai sai catarina
Come out, come out Catarina
Saia do mar venha ver, venha ver
Get out of the sea, Idalina comes to see
Sai sai catarina
Come out, come out Catarina
Sai do mar, venha ver, venha ver
Get out of the sea comme see, come see
Sai sai catarina
Come out, come out Catarina
Saia do mar, idalina vem ver
Get out of the sea, Idalina comes see
songs.history:
This song is about a guy who wants his girl Catarina to leave the sea and come see him. This song is really just a macho idea of attracting a woman' attention.

(source: LaLaue.com)

songs.title: Amanhã e dia santo
songs.translation:
Amanhã e dia santo
Tomorrow is Saint's Day
Um dois três
One, two, three
Dia de povo de deus
Day of God's People
Três e três: seis
Three and three: six
Quem tem roupa vai na missa
Those that have clothes go to Mass
Seis e três: nove
Six and three: nine
Quem nao tem faz como eu
Thos that don't, do like me
Nove e três: doze
Nine and three: twelve
Um dois três
One, two, three
Três e três: seis
Three and three: six
Seis e três: nove
Six and three: nine
Nove e três: doze
Nine and three: twelve
songs.history:
Song is in reference to the fact that Capoeira was traditionally an activity of the marginalised members of society – marginalised even within the black community.

Those that had better, more respectable jobs and could afford nice clothes would go to church. Those that didn’t have steady work and scraped out a living by any means they could would hang out on the streets and play Capoeira.

(source: LaLaue.com)

songs.title: A Bananeira caiu
songs.translation:
O facão bateu em baixo
The machete struck down
A bananeira caiu
The banana tree fell
O facão bateu em baixo
The machete struck down
A bananeira caiu
The banana tree fell
Cai cai bananeira
Fall, fall, banana tree
A bananeira caiu
The banana tree fell
Cai cai bananeira
Fall, fall, banana tree
A bananeira caiu
The banana tree fell
Bananeira em baixo
Banana tree below
A bananeira caiu
The banana tree fell
songs.history: Bananeira also refers to the handstand used in capoeira. This song may be appropriate to sing when a real valentão (valiant one) is taught the art of falling.

songs.title: Marinheiro So
songs.translation:
Eu não sou daqui
I’m not from here
marinheiro sou
I am sailor
eu não tenho amor
I have no love
marinheiro sou
I am sailor
eu sou da Bahia
I’m from Bahia
marinheiro sou
I am sailor
de são salvador
From Sao Salvador
marinheiro sou
I am sailor
o marinheiro marinheiro
Sailor Sailor
marinheiro sou
I am sailor
quem te ensinou a nadar
Who taught you to swim
marinheiro sou
I am sailor
o foi o tombo do navio
Was it the sinking of the ship
marinheiro sou
I am sailor
o foi o balanço do mar
Or it was the swing of the sea
marinheiro sou
I am sailor
la vem la vem
It comes it comes
marinheiro sou
I am sailor
ele vem faceiro
It comes faceiro
marinheiro sou
I am sailor
todo de branco
All white
marinheiro sou
I am sailor
com seu bonezinho
With his little hat
marinheiro sou
I am sailor

songs.title: Beira Mar
songs.translation:
Beira mar ioio
Seaside ioio
Beira mar iaia
Seaside iaia
Beira mar ioio
Seaside ioio
Beira mar iaia
Seaside iaia
Beira mar beira mar
Seaside seaside
é de ioio
it's ioio
beira mar beira mar
Seaside seaside
é de iaia
it's iaia
songs.history: The term beira-mar means sea-shore and the terms Ioio and Iaia are how slaves would usually refer to their masters and their masters’ children. This song gives reference to the sea-shores that often held such beauty in the northern states of Brazil and the fact that they would often belong to the slave-masters and mistresses.

songs.title: Meu Berimbau faz
songs.translation:
Meu berimbau faz tim tim don don
My berimbau does
Alegra minha alma
Makes my soul happy
A mente e o coraçao
The mind and the heart

songs.title: A maré tá cheia
songs.translation:
Olha o peixe pulo na maré
Look at the fish jumping in the tide
Olha o peixe pulo na maré
Look at the fish jumping in the tide
Olha o peixe pulo na maré
Look at the fish jumping in the tide
Olha o peixe pulo na maré
Look at the fish jumping in the tide
A maré ta cheia ioio
The tide is full ioio
A maré ta cheia iaia
The tide is full iaia
A maré ta cheia ioio
The tide is full ioio
A maré ta cheia iaia
The tide is full ioia
A maré subiu
The tide went up
Sobe maré
Tide rises
A maré desceu
The tide went out
Desce maré
Tide lowers
é maré de maré
it's tide of tide
Vou pra ilha de maré
I’m going to the tidal island

songs.title: A Manteiga Derramou
songs.translation:
Vou dizer a meu sinhô
I’ll tell my master
Que a manteiga derramou
The butter has melted
E a manteiga não é minha
And butter is not mine
E a manteiga é de ioiô
And butter is of the master
Vou dizer a meu sinhô
I’ll tell my master
Que a manteiga derramou
The butter has melted
E a manteiga não é minha
And butter is not mine
E a manteiga é de ioiô
And butter is of the master
Vou dizer a meu sinhô
I’ll tell my master
Que a manteiga derramou
The butter has melted
A manteiga é de ioiô
Butter is of the master
Caiu na água e se molhou
Fell into the water and got wet
Vou dizer a meu sinhô
I'll tell my master
Que a manteiga derramou
The butter has melted
A manteiga é do patrão
The butter is of the boss
Caiu no chão e derramou
Fell to the ground and poured
Vou dizer a meu sinhô
I'll tell my master
Que a manteiga derramou
The butter has melted
A manteiga não é minha
The butter is not mine
É pra filha de ioiô
it's for the child of the master
songs.history:
A slave narrative about a 'mysterious' spillage. A container full of butter has been knocked over, and no one is taking responsibility. When asked the slave says, "it's not my butter, it's the master's butter" which, while technically true, does not help resolve the matter. Slaves would often use such tactics of "passive resistance" to remind the master of his dependence on them.
(source: LaLaue.com)

songs.title: Ai, Ai, Aide
songs.translation:
ai ai aide
ai ai aide
aide aide aide
aide aide aide
songs.history: This song is frequently directed at players who are making mistakes or generally playing sloppily in the roda. It can also be sung as a celebration of a great game in progress.

songs.title: Folha Seca
songs.translation:
Eu pisei na folha seca
I stepped on the dry leaf
Eu ouvi fazer xuê, xuà
And head them go, xuà
Xuê, xuê, xuê, xuà
Xuê, xuê, xuê, xuà
Ouvi fazer xuê, xuà
I head you do xuê, xuà
Xuê, xuê, xuê, xuà
Xuê, xuê, xuê, xuà
Ouvi fazer xuê, xuà.
I heard how to do xuê, xuà.
Na volta que mundo deu
On the return that the world took
Na volta que mundo da
On the way back from the world
Ouvi fazer xuê, xuà
I heard how to do xuê, xuà
Xuê, xuê, xuê, xuà
Xuê, xuê, xuê, xuà
songs.history:
Song about the noise the leaves made when they were stepped on.

We might imagine that it is about a slave hiding in the forest, fearful knowing every step might be heard by the slave hunter, called the Capitão do Mato ("Captain of the Jungle").

(source: LaLaue.com)

songs.title: Lá na varanda
songs.translation:
Lá na varanda do meu casua
There on the balcony of my house
Tem varanda boa pra vadiar
There’s a good balcony to chill/play
Lá na varanda do meu casua
There on the balcony of my house
Tem varanda boa pra vadiar
There’s a good balcony to chill/play
O meu casua tem varanda
My house has a balcony
Varanda pra vadiar
A balcony to chill/play
O meu casua tem varanda
My house as a balcony
Varanda pra vadiar
A balcony to chill/play
Tem varanda boa
It's a good balcony
Varanda pra vadiar
A balcony to chill/play
Tem varanda boa
It's a good balcony
Varanda pra vadiar
A balcony to chill/play

songs.title: Vim no navio de Aruanda
songs.translation:
Vim no navio de Aruanda, Aruanda ê
I came on a ship from Aruanda
Vim no navio de Aruanda, Aruanda á
I came on a ship from Aruanda
Porque me trouxeram de Aruanda
Why they brought me from Aruanda
Pra que me trouxeram de Aruanda
For what I was brought from Aruanda
Vim no navio de Aruanda, Aruanda ê
I came on a ship from Aruanda
songs.history:
In the 1500’s, led by the explorer Pedro Alvares Cabral ,
Portuguese settlers arrived in Brazil. Now at this time, Brazil was one of the largest territories of the colonial empires, but lacked people to colonize it, especially workers.
And so it was that the Portuguese, like many European colonists, chose to use slaves to build their economy.
 
They first attempted to suppress
Brazilian natives in order to use them as slaves. However, this did
not go as planned since the natives either escaped or died in
captivity. And so, the Portuguese started importing slaves from Africa.

songs.title: Sou eu Maitá
songs.history:
This Cantiga is very common in many circles out there. And the strange thing is that each one sings in a different way. Maitá, Humaitá , MuayThai, Umaita etc. The fact is that many Capoeira songs are the result of true events in Brazil.

It is impossible to talk about the  Fortress of Humaitá without commenting on the War of the Triple Alliance (Brazil, Argentina and Uruguay) against Paraguay. The 3 teamed up against Marechal Solano López, after he wanted to invade the Argentine province of Entre Ríos, and Brazil, in Mato Grosso and Rio Grande do Sul (1865-70).

One of the objectives of this war was for Paraguay to conquer and raze the fortress of Humaitá that prevented Paraguay's free navigation.

songs.title: Bom jesus da lapa
songs.translation:
Bom Jesus da Lapa ê
Good Jesus of Lapa is
Bom Jesus da Lapa
Good Jesus of Lapa
Eu nunca fiz inimigo
I never made an enemy
Sai aonde vou pisar
Get out where I'm going to step
Eu só peço proteção
I only ask for postage
Pra maldade afastar
For evil to drive away
Bom Jesus da Lapa ê
Good Jesus of Lapa is
Bom Jesus da Lapa
Good Jesus of Lapa
Eu pedi você ajuda
I asked you for help
Para nada me faltar
For nothing to lack
Pois agora eu lhe agradeço
Well now I thank you
Bom Jesus da Lapa
Good Jesus of Lapa
Bom Jesus da Lapa ê
Good Jesus of Lapa is
Bom Jesus da Lapa
Good Jesus of Lapa
Quem manda no mundo é Deus
Who rules the world is God
E ninguém pode negar
And no one can deny
Eu não acredito em Santo
I don't believe in Saint
Não carrego patuá
I don't carry patuá
Bom Jesus da Lapa ê
Good Jesus of Lapa is
Bom Jesus da Lapa
Good Jesus of Lapa
Bom Jesus da Lapa ê
Good Jesus of Lapa is
Bom Jesus da Lapa
Good Jesus of Lapa
Bom Jesus da Lapa ê
Good Jesus of Lapa is
Bom Jesus da Lapa
Good Jesus of Lapa
Abençoe o meu caminho
Bless my way
Por onde eu caminhar
Where i walk
Ilumine a escuridão
Light up the darkness
Pra eu sempre enxergar
For me to always see
Bom Jesus da Lapa ê
Good Jesus of Lapa is
Bom Jesus da Lapa
Good Jesus of Lapa
songs.history: Bom Jesus Da Lapa - a municipality in Bahia, Brazil; the third largest Catholic festival in Brazil known as the Romaria (Portuguese for "Procession" or "Pilgrimage") of Bom Jesus, takes place there. The name means "Good Jesus of the Grotto.

songs.title: Samba lele bateu na porta
songs.translation:
Samba lêlê bateu na porta
Samba lêlê knocked at the door
Samba lêlê vai ver quem é
Samba lêlê go see who it is
Samba lêlê é meu amor
Samba lêlê it's my love
Samba lêlê samba no pé
Samba lêlê without foot
songs.history:
Samba Lêlê is a traditionally children's Brazilian song, which is also found in capoeira in different versions (lyrics and interpretations).

The chorus refers to a young man, Samba Lêlê, who still goes to visit his lover even though he broke his foot, and only has one valid one left.

songs.title: Levanta saia la vem a maré
songs.translation:
Levanta saia la vem a mare
Lift your skirt, there comes the tide
La vem a mare, la vem a mare
There comes the tide, There comes the tide

songs.title: Meu barco minha canoa
songs.translation:
Meu barco minha canoa
My boat, my canoe
não paro de remar 
does not stop to row
Eu remo favor da maré 
I row in the way of the tide
não deixa está fonte secar 
I do not let that source dry
